newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BP Australia says to boost refinery capacity.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BP Australia says to boost refinery capacity.

text.p: BP Australia Ltd said on Friday it will increase capacity at its Bulwer Island petroleum refinery in Queensland when it completes scheduled maintenance work in about a month.
The 57,000-barrels-a-day refinery was shut down for routine maintenance work on August 20, a company spokesman told Reuters.
The company is a unit of The British Petroleum Co Plc.
The spokesman said it was unclear at this stage how much of an increase would occur, although the intention was to lift output.
The refinery, the smallest in Australia, had been running at full capacity ahead of the shutdown, the spokesman said.
"We really won't know the exact amount until it's up and running again," the spokesman said.
